Learn how to integrate with external API: Learn how to integrate with external APIs and receive webhooks in MBC CQRS Serverless applications.
This guide explains how to integrate you: This guide explains how to integrate your MBC CQRS Serverless application with external APIs and services. Learn patterns for making HTTP requests, handling webhooks, implementing retry logic, and ensuring resilient integrations.
Use this guide when you need to:: Use this guide when you need to:
Call external REST APIs from your Lambda: Call external REST APIs from your Lambda handlers or services

Set appropriate timeouts and handle time: Set appropriate timeouts and handle timeout errors
No visibility into external API issues: No visibility into external API issues
The framework uses `node-fetch` for HTTP: The framework uses `node-fetch` for HTTP requests in its internal services. You can use the same approach or any HTTP client library compatible with Node.js.
You can also use Axios or NestJS HttpMod: You can also use Axios or NestJS HttpModule for HTTP requests:
When calling external APIs from Lambda,: When calling external APIs from Lambda, always set appropriate timeouts:
Recommended: Set timeout less than Lambd: Recommended: Set timeout less than Lambda timeout
Create a controller to receive webhooks: Create a controller to receive webhooks from external services:

Check timestamp to prevent replay attack: Check timestamp to prevent replay attacks
Process payment event based on type: Process payment event based on type
Update order status, trigger notificatio: Update order status, trigger notifications, etc.
Webhooks may be delivered multiple times: Webhooks may be delivered multiple times. Use idempotency keys to prevent duplicate processing:
Implement retry logic for transient fail: Implement retry logic for transient failures:
Execute a function with exponential back: Execute a function with exponential backoff retry
For production workloads, consider using: For production workloads, consider using AWS-native retry mechanisms:
Configure SQS to retry failed messages w: Configure SQS to retry failed messages with configurable `maxReceiveCount`
Use the built-in Retry and Catch blocks: Use the built-in Retry and Catch blocks in state machine definitions
Route failed invocations to SQS or SNS f: Route failed invocations to SQS or SNS for reprocessing
Retry 3 times before moving to DLQ: Retry 3 times before moving to DLQ
The circuit breaker pattern is not built: The circuit breaker pattern is not built into the framework. For production applications with high API call volumes, consider implementing a circuit breaker or using a library like `cockatiel` or `opossum`.
Return cached data or default response: Return cached data or default response
